title: Contributor Code of Conduct
text: contributors maintainers project, pledge respect people contribute reporting issues, posting feature requests, updating documentation, submitting pull requests patches, activities. committed making participation project harassment-free experience everyone, regardless level experience, gender, gender identity expression, sexual orientation, disability, personal appearance, body size, race, ethnicity, age, religion. Examples unacceptable behavior participants include use sexual language imagery, derogatory comments personal attacks, trolling, public private harassment, insults, unprofessional conduct. Project maintainers right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct. Project maintainers follow Code Conduct may removed project team. Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported opening issue contacting one project maintainers. Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant (https://contributor-covenant.org), version 1.0.0, available https://contributor-covenant.org/version/1/0/0/

title: CONTRIBUTING
text: Submit issue Issues page

title: CONTRIBUTING
text: Fork repo Github account Clone version account machine account, e.g,. git clone https://github.com/<yourgithubusername>/brranching.git Make sure track progress upstream (.e., version brranching ropensci/brranching) git remote add upstream https://github.com/ropensci/brranching.git. making changes make sure pull changes upstream either git fetch upstream merge later git pull upstream fetch merge one step Make changes (bonus points making changes new feature branch) Push account Submit pull request home base ropensci/brranching

previous_headings: brranching - an interface to phylogenetic data
text: Query Phylomatic phylogenetic tree. plot chunk unnamed-chunk-5 can pass 5000 names. can use taxize get random set plant species names. plot chunk unnamed-chunk-6
code: taxa <- c("Poa annua", "Phlox diffusa", "Helianthus annuus") tree <- phylomatic(taxa=taxa, get = 'POST') plot(tree, no.margin=TRUE) library("taxize") spp <- names_list("species", 200) out <- phylomatic(taxa = spp, get = "POST") plot(out, show.tip.label = FALSE)

previous_headings: brranching - an interface to phylogenetic data
text: plot chunk unnamed-chunk-7
code: library("phylocomr") ages_df <- data.frame(   a = c('malpighiales','eudicots','ericales_to_asterales','plantaginaceae',         'malvids', 'poales'),   b = c(81, 20, 56, 76, 47, 71) ) phylo_file <- system.file("examples/phylo_bladj", package = "phylocomr") phylo_str <- readLines(phylo_file) x <- rbladj(tree = phylo_str, ages = ages_df) library(ape) plot(x)

title: Fetch Phylogenies from Many Sources
text: Brranching interface many different sources phylogenetic data (currently Phylomatic (http://phylodiversity.net/phylomatic/), sources come) allows users query phylogenetic data using taxonomic names. brranching::phylomatic_names() function get NCBI Entrez API key. NCBI Entrez doesn’t require use API key, get higher rate limit key, 3 10 requests per second, get one. Run taxize::use_entrez() see https://ncbiinsights.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/2017/11/02/new-api-keys---e-utilities/ instructions.

title: Query Phylomatic for a phylogenetic tree. — phylomatic
text: Query Phylomatic phylogenetic tree.

title: Query Phylomatic for a phylogenetic tree. — phylomatic
code: phylomatic(   taxa,   taxnames = TRUE,   get = "GET",   informat = "newick",   method = "phylomatic",   storedtree = "R20120829",   treeuri = NULL,   taxaformat = "slashpath",   outformat = "newick",   clean = TRUE,   db = "apg",   mssgs = TRUE,   ... )

title: Query Phylomatic for a phylogenetic tree. — phylomatic
text: taxa Phylomatic format input taxa names. taxnames TRUE (default), get family names attach species names send Phylomatic API. FALSE, provide strings right format. get 'GET' (default) 'POST' format submission website. informat One newick (default), nexml, cdaordf. using stored tree, informat always newick. method One phylomatic (default) convert storedtree One R20120829 (Phylomatic tree R20120829 plants), smith2011 (Smith 2011, plants), binindaemonds2007 (Bininda-Emonds 2007, mammals), zanne2014 (Zanne et al. 2014, plants). Default: R20120829 treeuri URL phylogenetic tree newick format. taxaformat option slashpath now. Leave . outformat One newick, nexml, fyt. clean Return clean tree . Default: TRUE db One "ncbi", "itis", "apg". Default: apg mssgs Print messages. Default: TRUE ... curl options passed crul::HttpClient

title: Query Phylomatic for a phylogenetic tree. — phylomatic
text: Newick formatted tree phylo object nexml character string

title: Query Phylomatic for a phylogenetic tree. — phylomatic
text: Use web interface http://phylodiversity.net/phylomatic/ set taxnames = FALSE, need pass character vector, element like example: "asteraceae/taraxacum/taraxacum_officinale", form "family/genus/genus_specfic epithet"

title: Query Phylomatic for a phylogenetic tree. — phylomatic
code: if (FALSE) { # Input taxonomic names taxa <- c("Poa annua", "Phlox diffusa", "Helianthus annuus") tree <- phylomatic(taxa=taxa, get = 'POST') plot(tree, no.margin=TRUE)  # Genus names taxa <- c("Poa", "Phlox", "Helianthus") tree <- phylomatic(taxa=taxa, storedtree='R20120829', get='POST') plot(tree, no.margin=TRUE)  # Lots of names taxa <- c("Poa annua", "Collomia grandiflora", "Lilium lankongense", "Phlox diffusa", "Iteadaphne caudata", "Gagea sarmentosa", "Helianthus annuus") tree <- phylomatic(taxa=taxa, get = 'POST') plot(tree, no.margin=TRUE)  # Don't clean - clean=TRUE is default (tree <- phylomatic(taxa=taxa, clean = FALSE)) ## with clean=FALSE, you can get non-splitting nodes, which you ## need to collpase before plotting library('ape') plot(collapse.singles(tree), no.margin=TRUE)  # Output NeXML format taxa <- c("Gonocarpus leptothecus", "Gonocarpus leptothecus", "Lilium lankongense") out <- phylomatic(taxa=taxa, get = 'POST', outformat = "nexml") cat(out)  # Lots of names, note that when you have enough names (number depends on length of individual # names, so there's no per se rule), you will get an error when using `get='GET'`, # when that happens use `get='POST'` library("taxize") spp <- names_list("species", 500) # phylomatic(taxa = spp, get = "GET") (out <- phylomatic(taxa = spp, get = "POST", db = "itis")) plot(out) }

title: Use Phylomatic locally - ideal for large queries — phylomatic_local

title: Use Phylomatic locally - ideal for large queries — phylomatic_local
text: taxa (character) Phylomatic format input taxa names. required taxnames TRUE (default), get family names attach species names send Phylomatic API. FALSE, provide strings right format. See Details. storedtree One R20120829 (Phylomatic tree R20120829 plants), smith2011 (Smith 2011, plants), binindaemonds2007 (Bininda-Emonds 2007, mammals), zanne2014 (Zanne et al. 2014, plants). Default: R20120829 db (character) One "ncbi", "itis", "apg". Default: apg lowercase (logical) Convert chars taxa file lowercase. Default: FALSE nodes (logical) label nodes default names. Default: FALSE verbose (logical) Print messages. Default: TRUE

title: Use Phylomatic locally - ideal for large queries — phylomatic_local
text: Newick formatted tree phylo object

title: Use Phylomatic locally - ideal for large queries — phylomatic_local
text: uses phylocomr::ph_phylomatic() hood function uses Phylomatic via Phylocom using phylocomr package. interface slightly different phylomatic(): tree URL available, parameters included . set taxnames = FALSE, need pass character vector, element like example: "asteraceae/taraxacum/taraxacum_officinale", form "family/genus/genus_specfic epithet"

title: Use Phylomatic locally - ideal for large queries — phylomatic_local
code: if (FALSE) { library('ape')  # Input taxonomic names taxa <- c("Poa annua", "Phlox diffusa", "Helianthus annuus") (tree <- phylomatic_local(taxa)) plot(collapse.singles(tree), no.margin=TRUE)  taxa <- c("Poa annua", "Collomia grandiflora", "Lilium lankongense", "Phlox diffusa", "Iteadaphne caudata", "Gagea sarmentosa", "Helianthus annuus") (tree <- phylomatic_local(taxa)) plot(collapse.singles(tree), no.margin=TRUE)  library("taxize") spp <- names_list("species", 500) length(spp) (tree <- phylomatic_local(spp)) }

title: Phylomatic names — phylomatic_names
text: Get family names make Phylomatic input object, output input string Phylomatic use function phylomatic

title: Phylomatic names — phylomatic_names
text: taxa quoted tsn number (taxonomic serial number) format output format, isubmit (can paste Phylomatic website), 'rsubmit' use fxn phylomatic_tree db One "ncbi", "itis", "apg". use "apg", HTTP requests made (internet connection needed), whereas use "ncbi" "itis" need internet connection. IMPORTANT: see Authentication using "ncbi". ... curl options passed taxize::tax_name()

title: Phylomatic names — phylomatic_names
text: string (e.g., "pinaceae/pinus/pinus_contorta"), Phylomatic submission format

title: Phylomatic names — phylomatic_names
text: NCBI Entrez require use API key, get higher rate limit key, 3 10 requests per second, get one. Run taxize::use_entrez() see https://ncbiinsights.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/2017/11/02/new-api-keys---e-utilities/ instructions. NCBI API key handling logic done inside taxize package, used inside function. Save API key name ENTREZ_KEY R option .Rprofile file, environment variables either .Renviron file .bash_profile file, .zshrc file (use oh--zsh) similar. See Startup help R options environment variables. pass API key function. Remember restart R session (start new shell window/tab using shell) take advantage new R options environment variables. strongly recommend using environment variables R options. Note ENTREZ_KEY set, get message , function call. , can messages per R session, across function calls.

title: Phylomatic names — phylomatic_names
code: if (FALSE) { mynames <- c("Poa annua", "Salix goodingii", "Helianthus annuus") phylomatic_names(taxa = mynames, format='rsubmit') phylomatic_names(mynames, format='rsubmit', db="apg") phylomatic_names(mynames, format='isubmit', db="ncbi") phylomatic_names(mynames, format='isubmit', db="apg") }

Run Phylocom's bladj from R — rbladj
text: tree (character/phylo) One : phylogeny newick string (written temp file) - path file newick string - ape phylo object. required. ages (data.frame/character) ages data.frame, path ages file. required.

title: Run Phylocom's bladj from R — rbladj
text: Newick formatted tree phylo object

title: Run Phylocom's bladj from R — rbladj
text: uses phylocomr::ph_bladj() hood

title: Run Phylocom's bladj from R — rbladj
code: if (FALSE) { library("phylocomr")  # make an ages data.frame ages_df <- data.frame(   a = c('malpighiales','eudicots','ericales_to_asterales','plantaginaceae',         'malvids', 'poales'),   b = c(81, 20, 56, 76, 47, 71) )  # read phylogeny file as a string phylo_file <- system.file("examples/phylo_bladj", package = "phylocomr") phylo_str <- readLines(phylo_file)  # Run Bladj, returns phylo object (x <- rbladj(tree = phylo_str, ages = ages_df))  # load ape and plot tree library(ape) plot(x) }

(#15) related change , changed reading newick strings use phytools::read.newick() instead ape::read.tree(), handles result clean=FALSE phylomatic() phylomatic_local() (#16) Documented storedtree parameter phylomatic() phylomatic_local() tree Zanne et al. also available using storedtree="zanne2014" (#19)
